issue.title: [C++] [CI] Check benchmarks in CI
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-7326](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7326). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
This would avoid regressions (compile errors etc.).

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7326?focusedCommentId=16988588) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Ideally we can use environment variables to make benchmark time minimal but they don't seem to work here:
https://github.com/google/benchmark/issues/913

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7326?focusedCommentId=17092938) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
We should at least \***compile**\* the benchmarks, but we need not necessarily run them

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7326?focusedCommentId=17394154) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
We compiling benchmarks at least in the `conda-cpp` build, also we now have our own continuous benchmarking setup thanks to `conbench`.
